column4: how do I troubleshoot:  Firefox can't find the server at www.google.com.   from the live cd?
check the networking settings.. sounds like a dns problem
try pinging 64.233.183.147 , it's a google.com machine
yep, can ping 64.233.183.147 perfectly, so it's a dns problem?
yup.. I'm guessing dns then.. what does "cat /etc/resolv.conf" tell you?
domain vs.shawcable.net and some other info
no lines that start with "nameserver xxx.xxx.xxx.xx" ?
ok.. let's try this.. "gksudo gedit /etc/resolv.conf" and change that first nameserver line to use 208.67.222.222 instead of whatever is there now
that's one of the opendns servers..
then save the file and close the editor

now, this isn't a lasting solution.. it might break the next time you update your ip from the dhcp server.. or it might break the next time you restart.. so write down that ip number so you can do this again
yes, works for now.  thanks very much.
